intro: Pelargonium radulifolium, commonly known as the radulifolium geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Pelargonium radulifolium is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of garden settings.
